title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel set in the 1920s about the American dream.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A story of racial injustice and moral growth in the Deep South.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel about totalitarianism and surveillance.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel about manners and matrimonial machinations.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: A thrilling tale of obsession and revenge on the high seas.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A sweeping epic of love and war during the Napoleonic era.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A teenager's exploration of identity and rebellion in the 1950s.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy adventure in Middle-earth before the events of The Lord of the Rings.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A tragic tale of love, betrayal, and Russian society.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological drama of guilt and redemption in 19th-century Russia.
